title: PrintFriendly
content: PrintFriendly. Does the latest update to desktop Firefox still support PrintFriendly? I need it for making websites legible, but Firefox disabled it for Android (and won't let me go back to earlier versions), so I'm afraid to update the desktop version. Added security doesn't help if I can't read what's on a webpage. I'm running version 85.0.2, on Windows 7 Pro.
creator: gk7

title: missing profile
content: How do I get Firefox to recognize the profile that is in my Library on a Mac? I didn't touch it; did nothing to it, but when I tried to open Firefox it suddenly was missing. And your Help system HAS WAY TOO MUCH INFORMATION IT SO AS TO BE NOTHING BUT CONFUSING. I AM NOT A CODE JOCK OR A WEB DEVELOPER OR SOMETHING. END RESULT: YOUR HELP SYSTEM IS USELESS!!!!!!!! I even tried deleting my current Firefox and downloading a fresh app. SAME THING! Please answer back with a REAL person, not some canned menu of HUNDREDS OF OPTIONS. Or, I will simply not touch anything from Mozilla again. Now that is SIMPLICITY!!!!

title: Unable to log into Xfinity.com
content:
I am unable to log into xfinity.com. I can log into my account there on Chrome and Edge so the assumption is that it is a Firefox issue. I've cleared my cache, site data and cookies in Firefox but that didn't help. I've run an IPV6 test and scored 10/10.

Not sure what to do next.

Thanks for the help.
creator: fatherlemming

title: site not displaying properly in firefox
content: HELLO I have a website https://www.feluda.co which I have made using Wix but now that I am testing it in different browser - I am surprised to see that it works flawlessly on chrome, edge, ie9, opera, brave etc but not in firefox .In firefox the website is misaligned and there are other issues. What could be the reason for this website display issues ? I have contacted Wix and they said, problem does not lie on their side I am totally puzzled :-( Regards, sumit

creator: jimwje

title: How to block Firefox update notifications
content:
My god, this is driving me nuts. I will decide if and when I want to "update" a program, excepting of course the steaming pile that is Windows 10 where they cram it down your throats, often at a profoundly inconvenient time.

But after doing some upgrades to an old computer and installing v. 86 of FF, two days later it's in constant nag mode. I've shut off everything I can, I've tweaked about:config so much it's a wonder it still works at all. Everytime I start up the computer it displays a notification about do I want to allow FF to make changes. Not no, it's hell no. Everytime I start up FF I get a popup, (uh, wasn't FF supposed to have eliminate them?) nagging at me to upgrade. Then if I'm on for a while it nags me again. The more I get nagged, the more I push back. Now I may break something, FF, keyboard, whatever, but nagging me will not result in me doing what the nag wants. "Updates" over the years have made so many more things worse than better I can't even count. I've been using FF for ~15 years, generally been happy with it, but this is driving me nuts. How to I fix it? Fix, as in repair so it works like I want it to and like it used to. It's broken. Or should I just migrate to another browser?
creator: mw999

title: Unwanted messages while using Firefox
content: While using the Firefox Browser, annoying messages about dating, security and the like keep popping on to the screen. I have installed blocking extension. I have disabled "snippets" as was advised. If this continues, I will be forced to use Chrome or Safari.
creator: md70118
